result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah A.V. Moren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaiah A.V. Moren is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Isaiah A.V. Moren was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:13 P.M. Defendant Isaiah A.V. Moren in court, in custody.  Calling 16cf197, 15CM172, 16CM539, 16TR2533, 16FO940. Defendant states he was arrested on 6/24/17 and is only in custody because of fines. Defendant states if he gets out he has work set up with his father - roofing, drywell, etc. - can pay $100 per month. Court allows release from jail. Cautions defendant of need to follow-through and attend next review hearing. Father is present in court and would like an accounting of fines due as defendant has too much paperwork. Court advises that defendant must make effort to figure out total fines. Adj. 2:16 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 18, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

9:54 a.m. Defendant Isaiah A.V. Moren in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Isaiah A.V. Moren in custody.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm172 and 15cf218. Michlig/Voorhees statement to agreement.  Plea questionaires filed. State moves to dismiss Count 2 in 15cm72 - Granted.  State moves to dismiss but read-in Count 1 in 15cf218 - Granted. Voorhees enters guilty plea to Count 2 in 15cf218 and no contest to Count 1 in 15cm172.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.
